title.narrative: The Netherlands Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Programme 2020-2024 - Iraq

description.narrative: Under the Mine Action and Cluster Munitions Program, HI will contribute to enhance human security amongst communities of Kirkuk governorate in Iraq impacted by Explosive Ordnance, and support them to influence duty bearers about issues that matter in promoting change. To that end, the project will adhere to a Comprehensive Approach to Mine Action, integrating Land Release, Risk Education, Community Liaison, Livelihoods and Victim Assistance and support to national mine action authorities.

title.narrative: Output 1.2 - Risk of EO related death and injury is reduced
1.2.1. # of RE beneficiaries who demonstrate increased knowledge

comment.narrative: As EORE activities started in June, this indicator has not been calculated yet.

HI EORE teams conducts 1 EORE Pre-Post Test for each EORE session, the result of which is then extrapolated to represent all participants in the specific session. 183 EORE pre-post tests were conducted during this reporting period.

HI conducted a pre/post-test for one individual per session, but sometimes participants do not feel comfortable doing the test and sharing their contact information. Therefore, HI was able to conduct 30 pre/post-tests for 30 individuals through 42 sessions. 30 beneficiaries (100%) demonstrated increased knowledge

HI conducted one EORE Pre-Post Test for each EORE session, and HI then extrapolated the result to represent all participants in the specific session. As a result, HI conducted 168 EORE pre-post tests during this reporting period.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024
Risk Education activity are planned to be launched in Iraq in June 2021

title.narrative: 1.2.2. # of RE beneficiaries who demonstrate knowledge retention

comment.narrative: As EORE activities started in June, this indicator has not been calculated yet.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024
Risk Education activity are planned to be launched in Iraq in June 2021
The achievement under this indicator will be calculated 6 months to 1 year after the EORE activity started to measure impact ( EORE activities started in June 2021)
The achievement under this indicator will be calculated 6 months to 1 year after the EORE activity. The EORE retention assessment is therefore planned to start mid-2022
The achievement under this indicator will be calculated 6 months to 1 year after the EORE activity. The EORE retention assessment is therefore planned to start in May 2022

As mentioned in previous quarterly report - Risk Education activities started in June 2021. During the reporting period, HI conducted 10 direct EORE outdoor sessions in Hawija, reaching a total of 48 beneficiaries. HI also introduced dissemination of key EORE messages via loudspeakers - a modality which HI has introduced as a complementary activity to direct session following the COVID-19 pandemic. HI conducted 26 loudspeakers sessions in Hawija, targeting a total of 455 indirect beneficiaries - that are not counted under this indicator.

HI conducted 168 direct sessions reaching 2,161 beneficiaries in Hawija and Daquq districts. However, not everyone in the community accepts families from different houses to gather in one house, especially when there are only women in the house, affecting the beneficiaries' direct reach. An additional reason for a lower number of beneficiaries reached in this quarter is the distance of the houses in remote villages, where HI is currently delivering EORE sessions. In addition, HI was waiting for new Task Orders (TO) from DMA in January, which was finally issued in February. Therefore, the presented numbers reflect two months of implementation.
HI has also conducted eight indirect EORE sessions through the modified approach of EORE delivery - dissemination of key safe messages by loudspeakers - reaching additional 565 beneficiaries in the Hawija and Daquq districts, including an estimated 113 men, 113 women, 168 boys, and 171 girls. Note that this will be counted under indicator 1.2.6 at the annual report stage. HI continues providing direct alongside alternative indirect EORE activities, HI will start conducting more group sessions with a special focus on the outdoor sessions, especially in the markets, streets, or any places with gatherings, and liaise with Mukhtars to enable village groups session. Previously, the pandemic was not permitting this kind of activity. Additionally, HI will revise the session's curriculum to reduce the time that will allow for faster movement between houses and villages in remote locations.

HI conducted 183 direct sessions reaching 2247 beneficiaries in Hawija and Daquq districts. However, not everyone in the community accepts door-to-door sessions due to the COVID-19 pandemic, affecting beneficiaries' direct reach. In Dec 2021, HI reached seven schools in Hawija and Daquq in order to reach children, a key at-risk group. HI has also conducted 21 indirect EORE sessions through the modified approach of EORE delivery - dissemination of key safe messages by loudspeakers - reaching additional 2,695 beneficiaries in the Hawija and Daquq districts, including 541 men, 541 women, 805 boys, and 808 girls. Note that this will be counted under indicator 1.2.6 at annual report stage. HI continues providing direct alongside alternative indirect EORE activities, however the COVID-19 pandemic continues to impact the direct house to house activities considerably. As a mitigation step, HI requested and received a new task order for villages in Hawija to target additional communities and will continue both modalities to increase the beneficiary reach.

HI conducted 42 direct sessions reaching 556 beneficiaries in Daquq and Hawija districts. However, not everyone in the community accepts door-to-door sessions due to the COVID-19 pandemic, affecting beneficiaries' direct reach. In Q4, HI plans to target schools to increase the number of children reached and community-based societies or forums such as farmer's societies and village development committees to increase the number of adults reached through direct RE sessions. HI has also conducted 64 indirect RE sessions through the modified approach of RE delivery - dissemination of key safe messages by loudspeakers - reaching 1,465 beneficiaries in the Hawija and Daquq districts. This correspond to a new indicator that HI as requested BUZA in the Annual Plans submission, but which was not validated before November 25th and therefore not considered in QR3.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024
Risk Education activity are planned to be launched in Iraq in June 2021

title.narrative: 1.2.5. # Community Focal Points / Risk education teachers trained

comment.narrative: During the reporting period, HI carried out the CFPs selection process. The community focal point training is planned for the first and second quarter of 2022.

HI conducted training for 23 new community focal points (CFP) from Hawija and Daquq on the 29th and 30th of March 2022. These CFPs will receive quality assurance (QA) visits in the following months. Each CFP should pass two positive QA, after which they will receive a certificate.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024
Risk Education activity are planned to be launched in Iraq in June 2021
The community focal point training is planned for the first and second quarter of 2022.
This activity is planned for October - December 2021

title.narrative: Output 1.1 - Access to resources, infrastructures and livelihoods is improved
1.1.3. # items destroyed disaggregated by type (AP, AT, IED, UXO, AXO, etc.).

comment.narrative: Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024
As communicated with the donor, clearance operations in Iraq were temporarily suspended from March 1st 2021 onwards. They are planned to resume in June 2021.

During the reporting period, HI Iraq team was impacted by a prolonged suspension of its clearance activities in Kirkuk. This is due to a suspension of access letters for all INGOs in Iraq, induced by new regulations imposed by the Directorate of NGOs, which affected access to field operations until June. This was followed by visa constraints for HI's EOD international staff. Clearance activities are planned to start again end of August 2021.

During this quarter, HI found 11 IEDs but they were not destroyed by HI because NGOs are not permitted to carry out destruction in the Federal Iraq. Therefore, HI handed over the items to the local authorities.

During this quarter, HI found two IEDs but they were not destroyed by HI because NGOs are not permitted to carry out destruction in the Federal Iraq. Therefore, HI handed over the items to the local authorities.
HI identified two IEDs during the reporting period. Both were handed over to local authorities (DMA) for safe destruction.
No items were found during the reporting period

comment.narrative: 11,250 m2 was reduced in Al-Bashir village, Kirkuk during the reporting period but not yet released to DMA. HI hands over the land after completing clearance work for each specific land area.
15,405 m2 was reduced in Al-Bashir village, Kirkuk during the reporting period but not yet released to DMA. HI hands over the land after completing clearance work for each specific land area.
21,100 m2 has been cleared in Al-Bashir village, Kirkuk during the reporting period but not yet released to DMA. HI hands over the land after completing clearance work for each specific land area.
22,975 m2 was cleared in Al-Bashir village, Kirkuk during the reporting period but was not yet released to DMA, as HI hands over the land after completing clearance work for each specific land area.
25,920 m2 was cleared in Al-Bashir village, Kirkuk during the reporting period but was not yet released to DMA, as HI hands over the land after completing clearance work for each specific land area.
Target for the period from 01/09/2020 to 31/08/2024

During the reporting period, there have not been any cancellation activities.

As communicated with the donor, clearance operations in Iraq were temporarily suspended from March 1st 2021 onwards. They are planned to resume in June 2021.

During the reporting period, HI Iraq team was impacted by a prolonged suspension of its clearance activities in Kirkuk. This is due to a suspension of access letters for all INGOs in Iraq, induced by new regulations imposed by the Directorate of NGOs, which affected access to field operations until June. This was followed by visa constraints for HI's EOD international staff. Clearance activities are planned to start again end of August 2021.

Implementation of clearance activities was on hold until 29th August 2021 due to HR turnover and recruitment delay at HI level. Within the reporting period, no EOD spot tasks occurred. As explained in the Annual Plans submitted to BUZA on 1st October, the presence of Popular Mobilization Forces in the implementation area is analysed to be a barrier for HI to be tasked on EOD - thus explaining the requested reduction of the target.
Spot tasks are planned to be conducted under this grant from Q2 of 2022 onwards
Spot tasks are planned to be conducted under this grant from Q2 of 2022 onwards
